alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 3:15PM CDT until September 04 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Jefferson Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southwestern Orleans Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Eastern St. Charles Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 315 PM CDT, Thunderstorms continue to produce heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen and caused numerous flooded roadways. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring across many areas in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Marrero, Avondale, Metairie, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Bridge City, Elmwood, River Ridge, Estelle, Waggaman, Woodmere, Terrytown and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 226 and 241. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
